author: flo (tonebytone)
content: You wrote: "The Fujifilm X-100 was the big sensation this year, and while I find the camera extremely attractive and its image quality even better than that of the D300, it only covers a very small niche. An attractive niche though, and essentially the same as my PEN with the 17/2.8. Still, its lens, excellent as it is, canâ€™t be changed and the camera has no stabilization at all. Fine, but not for me." This camera DOES have stabilization! But you have to turn it on for it to work. Its icon that shows in the LED screen on the camera's back is a yellow camera with the shake marks on either side - plus there's what looks like an exclamation point to its left. This stabilization has worked beautifully for me, except of course at slow speeds of, say, 1/5th sec or so. And that's when I'd really really love to have stabilization! Thanks for the run-down on the various camera models. I'll have to check out the Olympus E-P2 and E-P3, with your comments in mind.
